maml:description.maml:para: Connect to a specified LM portal to run commands against

Connect to a specified LM portal which will allow you run the other LM commands associated with the Logic.Monitor PS module. Used in conjunction with Disconnect-LMAccount to close a session previously connected via Connect-LMAccount
Access ID from your API credential acquired from the LM Portal
Access Key from your API credential acquired from the LM Portal
The subdomain for your LM portal, the name before ".logicmonitor.com" (subdomain.logicmonitor.com)

Disables on stdout messages from displaying for any subsequent commands are run. Useful when building scripted logicmodules and you want to suppress unwanted output. Console logging is enabled by default.
Bearer token from your API credential acquired from the LM Portal. For use in place of LMv1 token
The subdomain for your LM portal, the name before ".logicmonitor.com" (subdomain.logicmonitor.com)

Disables on stdout messages from displaying for any subsequent commands are run. Useful when building scripted logicmodules and you want to suppress unwanted output. Console logging is enabled by default.
The subdomain for your LM portal, the name before ".logicmonitor.com" (subdomain.logicmonitor.com)
Use session sync capability instead of api key

Disables on stdout messages from displaying for any subsequent commands are run. Useful when building scripted logicmodules and you want to suppress unwanted output. Console logging is enabled by default.
This will list all cached account for you to pick from. This parameter is optional
Name of cached account you wish to connect to. This parameter is optional and can be used in place of UseCachedCredential

Disables on stdout messages from displaying for any subsequent commands are run. Useful when building scripted logicmodules and you want to suppress unwanted output. Console logging is enabled by default.
Access ID from your API credential acquired from the LM Portal
Access Key from your API credential acquired from the LM Portal
Bearer token from your API credential acquired from the LM Portal. For use in place of LMv1 token
The subdomain for your LM portal, the name before ".logicmonitor.com" (subdomain.logicmonitor.com)
This will list all cached account for you to pick from. This parameter is optional
Name of cached account you wish to connect to. This parameter is optional and can be used in place of UseCachedCredential
Use session sync capability instead of api key

Disables on stdout messages from displaying for any subsequent commands are run. Useful when building scripted logicmodules and you want to suppress unwanted output. Console logging is enabled by default.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this command.

maml:alert.maml:para: You must run this command before you will be able to execute other commands included with the Logic.Monitor module.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Connect-LMAccount -AccessId xxxxxx -AccessKey xxxxxx -AccountName subdomain

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Connect-LMAccount -BearerToken xxxxxx -AccountName subdomain

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Connect-LMAccount -UseCachedCredential

maml:description.maml:para: Copies a LogicMonitor dashboard to a new dashboard.

The Copy-LMDashboard function allows you to copy a LogicMonitor dashboard to a new dashboard. You can specify the name, ID, or group name of the dashboard to be copied, as well as provide a new name and optional description for the copied dashboard. The function requires valid API credentials and a logged-in session.
The name of the new dashboard.
The ID of the dashboard to be copied. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Id' or 'GroupName-Id' parameter sets.
An optional description for the new dashboard.
The name of the parent group for the new dashboard. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupName-Id' or 'GroupName-Name' parameter sets.
The name of the new dashboard.
The ID of the dashboard to be copied. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Id' or 'GroupName-Id' parameter sets.
An optional description for the new dashboard.
The ID of the parent group for the new dashboard. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Id' or 'GroupId-Name' parameter sets.
The name of the new dashboard.
The name of the dashboard to be copied. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Name' or 'GroupName-Name' parameter sets.
An optional description for the new dashboard.
The name of the parent group for the new dashboard. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupName-Id' or 'GroupName-Name' parameter sets.
The name of the new dashboard.
The name of the dashboard to be copied. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Name' or 'GroupName-Name' parameter sets.
An optional description for the new dashboard.
The ID of the parent group for the new dashboard. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Id' or 'GroupId-Name' parameter sets.
The name of the new dashboard.
The ID of the dashboard to be copied. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Id' or 'GroupName-Id' parameter sets.
The name of the dashboard to be copied. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Name' or 'GroupName-Name' parameter sets.
An optional description for the new dashboard.
The ID of the parent group for the new dashboard. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId-Id' or 'GroupId-Name' parameter sets.
The name of the parent group for the new dashboard. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupName-Id' or 'GroupName-Name' parameter sets.

maml:alert.maml:para: Ensure that you are logged in before running any commands by using the Connect-LMAccount cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Copy-LMDashboard -Name "New Dashboard" -DashboardId 12345 -ParentGroupId 67890 Copies the dashboard with ID 12345 to a new dashboard named "New Dashboard" in the group with ID 67890.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Copy-LMDashboard -Name "New Dashboard" -DashboardName "Old Dashboard" -ParentGroupName "Group A" Copies the dashboard named "Old Dashboard" to a new dashboard named "New Dashboard" in the group named "Group A".

maml:description.maml:para: The Copy-LMDevice function is used to create a copy of a LogicMonitor device. It takes the name, display name, description, and device object as parameters and creates a new device with the specified properties.
The name of the new device.
The display name of the new device. If not provided, the name parameter will be used as the display name.
The description of the new device.
The device object of the reference device that will be copied.
The name of the new device.
The display name of the new device. If not provided, the name parameter will be used as the display name.
The description of the new device.
The device object of the reference device that will be copied.

maml:alert.maml:para: Any custom properties from the reference device that are masked will need to be updated on the cloned resource, as those values are not available to the LogicMonitor API.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Copy-LMDevice -Name "NewDevice" -DeviceObject $deviceObject Creates a copy of the device specified by the $deviceObject variable with the name "NewDevice".

maml:description.maml:para: The Copy-LMReport function is used to copy a LogicMonitor report. It takes the following parameters: - Name: The name of the report.
- Description: The description of the report.
- ParentGroupId: The ID of the parent group.
- ReportObject: The report object to be copied.
The ID of the parent group.
The report object to be copied.
The ID of the parent group.
The report object to be copied.

maml:alert.maml:para: Please ensure you are logged in before running any commands. Use Connect-LMAccount to login and try again.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Copy-LMReport -Name "Report1" -Description "This is a sample report" -ParentGroupId "12345" -ReportObject $reportObject

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example copies the report specified by the ReportObject parameter and sets the name, description, and parent group ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnect from a previously connected LM portal
Clears stored API credentials for a previously connected LM portal. Useful for switching between LM portals or clearing credentials after a script runs

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this command.

maml:alert.maml:para: Once disconnect you will need to reconnect to a portal before you will be allowed to run commands again.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Disconnect-LMAccount

maml:description.maml:para: Exports device data from Logic Monitor.

The Export-LMDeviceData function exports device data from Logic Monitor based on the specified parameters. It collects data from the specified devices, their datasources, and their instances within a specified time range. The exported data can be saved in JSON or CSV format.
Specifies the ID of the device to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceDisplayName, DeviceHostName, DeviceGroupId, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the start date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time minus 1 hour.
Specifies the end date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time.
Specifies the filter for including specific datasources. By default, it includes all datasources.
Specifies the filter for excluding specific datasources. By default, no datasources are excluded.
Specifies the format for exporting the data. Valid values are "csv", "json", or "none". By default, it is set to "none".
Specifies the path where the exported data will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.
Specifies the display name of the device to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceHostName, DeviceGroupId, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the start date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time minus 1 hour.
Specifies the end date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time.
Specifies the filter for including specific datasources. By default, it includes all datasources.
Specifies the filter for excluding specific datasources. By default, no datasources are excluded.
Specifies the format for exporting the data. Valid values are "csv", "json", or "none". By default, it is set to "none".
Specifies the path where the exported data will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.
Specifies the host name of the device to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceDisplayName, DeviceGroupId, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the start date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time minus 1 hour.
Specifies the end date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time.
Specifies the filter for including specific datasources. By default, it includes all datasources.
Specifies the filter for excluding specific datasources. By default, no datasources are excluded.
Specifies the format for exporting the data. Valid values are "csv", "json", or "none". By default, it is set to "none".
Specifies the path where the exported data will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.
Specifies the ID of the device group to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceDisplayName, DeviceHostName, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the start date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time minus 1 hour.
Specifies the end date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time.
Specifies the filter for including specific datasources. By default, it includes all datasources.
Specifies the filter for excluding specific datasources. By default, no datasources are excluded.
Specifies the format for exporting the data. Valid values are "csv", "json", or "none". By default, it is set to "none".
Specifies the path where the exported data will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.
Specifies the name of the device group to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceDisplayName, DeviceHostName, and DeviceGroupId parameters.
Specifies the start date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time minus 1 hour.
Specifies the end date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time.
Specifies the filter for including specific datasources. By default, it includes all datasources.
Specifies the filter for excluding specific datasources. By default, no datasources are excluded.
Specifies the format for exporting the data. Valid values are "csv", "json", or "none". By default, it is set to "none".
Specifies the path where the exported data will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.
Specifies the ID of the device to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceDisplayName, DeviceHostName, DeviceGroupId, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the display name of the device to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceHostName, DeviceGroupId, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the host name of the device to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceDisplayName, DeviceGroupId, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the ID of the device group to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceDisplayName, DeviceHostName, and DeviceGroupName parameters.
Specifies the name of the device group to export data for. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the DeviceId, DeviceDisplayName, DeviceHostName, and DeviceGroupId parameters.
Specifies the start date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time minus 1 hour.
Specifies the end date and time for the data collection. By default, it is set to the current date and time.
Specifies the filter for including specific datasources. By default, it includes all datasources.
Specifies the filter for excluding specific datasources. By default, no datasources are excluded.
Specifies the format for exporting the data. Valid values are "csv", "json", or "none". By default, it is set to "none".
Specifies the path where the exported data will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-LMDeviceData -DeviceId 12345 -StartDate (Get-Date).AddDays(-7) -EndDate (Get-Date) -ExportFormat json -ExportPath "C:\LMData"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exports device data for the device with ID 12345, collecting data for the last 7 days and saving it in JSON format at the specified path.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-LMDeviceData -DeviceGroupName "Production Servers" -StartDate (Get-Date).AddHours(-12) -ExportFormat csv

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exports device data for all devices in the "Production Servers" group, collecting data for the last 12 hours and saving it in CSV format at the current location.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the status of the LogicMonitor account.
The Get-LMAccountStatus function is used to retrieve the status of the LogicMonitor account. It checks if the user is currently logged into any LogicMonitor portals and returns the account status.

dev:type.maml:name: The function returns a custom object with the following properties:
- Valid: Indicates if the user is currently logged into a LogicMonitor portal.
- Logging: Indicates if logging is enabled for the LogicMonitor account.
- Type: The type of authentication used for the LogicMonitor account.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAccountStatus

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example demonstrates how to use the Get-LMAccountStatus function to retrieve the status of the LogicMonitor account.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves LogicMonitor alerts based on specified parameters.

The Get-LMAlert function retrieves LogicMonitor alerts based on the specified parameters. It supports filtering alerts by start and end dates, severity, type, cleared status, and custom columns. The function makes API requests to the LogicMonitor platform and returns the retrieved alerts.
Specifies the start date for filtering alerts. Only alerts that occurred after this date will be retrieved.
Specifies the end date for filtering alerts. Only alerts that occurred before this date will be retrieved.
Specifies the severity level of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "Warning", "Error", and "Critical". The default value is "*".
Specifies the type of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "websiteAlert", "dataSourceAlert", "eventSourceAlert", and "logAlert". The default value is "*".
Specifies whether to retrieve cleared alerts. If set to $true, cleared alerts will be included in the results. If set to $false, only active alerts will be included. The default value is $false.
Specifies the number of alerts to retrieve per API request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the sorting order of the retrieved alerts. The default value is "resourceId".
Specifies the ID of a specific alert to retrieve.
Specifies the severity level of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "Warning", "Error", and "Critical". The default value is "*".
Specifies the type of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "websiteAlert", "dataSourceAlert", "eventSourceAlert", and "logAlert". The default value is "*".
Specifies whether to retrieve cleared alerts. If set to $true, cleared alerts will be included in the results. If set to $false, only active alerts will be included. The default value is $false.
Specifies an array of custom columns to include in the retrieved alerts.
Specifies the number of alerts to retrieve per API request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the sorting order of the retrieved alerts. The default value is "resourceId".
Specifies the severity level of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "Warning", "Error", and "Critical". The default value is "*".
Specifies the type of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "websiteAlert", "dataSourceAlert", "eventSourceAlert", and "logAlert". The default value is "*".
Specifies whether to retrieve cleared alerts. If set to $true, cleared alerts will be included in the results. If set to $false, only active alerts will be included. The default value is $false.
Specifies a custom filter object to further refine the alerts to retrieve.
Specifies the number of alerts to retrieve per API request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the sorting order of the retrieved alerts. The default value is "resourceId".
Specifies the start date for filtering alerts. Only alerts that occurred after this date will be retrieved.
Specifies the end date for filtering alerts. Only alerts that occurred before this date will be retrieved.
Specifies the ID of a specific alert to retrieve.
Specifies the severity level of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "Warning", "Error", and "Critical". The default value is "*".
Specifies the type of alerts to retrieve. Valid values are "*", "websiteAlert", "dataSourceAlert", "eventSourceAlert", and "logAlert". The default value is "*".
Specifies whether to retrieve cleared alerts. If set to $true, cleared alerts will be included in the results. If set to $false, only active alerts will be included. The default value is $false.
Specifies a custom filter object to further refine the alerts to retrieve.
Specifies an array of custom columns to include in the retrieved alerts.
Specifies the number of alerts to retrieve per API request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the sorting order of the retrieved alerts. The default value is "resourceId".

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid API authentication session. Use the Connect-LMAccount function to log in before running this command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAlert -StartDate (Get-Date).AddDays(-7) -EndDate (Get-Date) -Severity "Error" -Type "websiteAlert" -ClearedAlerts $false Retrieves all alerts that occurred within the last 7 days, have a severity level of "Error", are of type "websiteAlert", and are not cleared.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAlert -Id "12345" -CustomColumns "Column1", "Column2" Retrieves a specific alert with the ID "12345" and includes the custom columns "Column1" and "Column2" in the result.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves LogicMonitor alert rules based on specified parameters.

The Get-LMAlertRule function retrieves LogicMonitor alert rules based on the specified parameters. It supports retrieving alert rules by ID, name, or using a filter. The function uses the LogicMonitor REST API to make the requests.
Specifies the ID of the alert rule to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name and Filter parameters.
Specifies the number of alert rules to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the name of the alert rule to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Filter parameters.
Specifies the number of alert rules to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies a filter object to retrieve alert rules based on specific criteria. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Name parameters.
Specifies the number of alert rules to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the ID of the alert rule to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name and Filter parameters.
Specifies the name of the alert rule to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Filter parameters.
Specifies a filter object to retrieve alert rules based on specific criteria. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Name parameters.
Specifies the number of alert rules to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid LogicMonitor API authentication. Use Connect-LMAccount to authenticate before running this function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAlertRule -Id 123 Retrieves the alert rule with the specified ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAlertRule -Name "High CPU Usage" Retrieves the alert rule with the specified name.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves LogicMonitor API tokens based on specified parameters.

The Get-LMAPIToken function retrieves LogicMonitor API tokens based on the specified parameters. It supports various parameter sets to filter the tokens based on different criteria such as AdminId, Id, AccessId, and Filter. The function also allows specifying the token type and batch size for pagination.
Specifies the ID of the admin for which to retrieve API tokens. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'AdminId' parameter set.
Specifies the type of API token to retrieve. Valid values are 'LMv1', 'Bearer', or '*'. The default value is '*'.
Specifies the number of API tokens to retrieve per batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the ID of the API token to retrieve. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'Id' parameter set.
Specifies the type of API token to retrieve. Valid values are 'LMv1', 'Bearer', or '*'. The default value is '*'.
Specifies the number of API tokens to retrieve per batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the access ID of the API token to retrieve. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'AccessId' parameter set.
Specifies the type of API token to retrieve. Valid values are 'LMv1', 'Bearer', or '*'. The default value is '*'.
Specifies the number of API tokens to retrieve per batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies a custom filter object to retrieve API tokens based on specific criteria. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'Filter' parameter set.
Specifies the type of API token to retrieve. Valid values are 'LMv1', 'Bearer', or '*'. The default value is '*'.
Specifies the number of API tokens to retrieve per batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the ID of the admin for which to retrieve API tokens. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'AdminId' parameter set.
Specifies the ID of the API token to retrieve. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'Id' parameter set.
Specifies the access ID of the API token to retrieve. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'AccessId' parameter set.
Specifies a custom filter object to retrieve API tokens based on specific criteria. This parameter is only applicable when using the 'Filter' parameter set.
Specifies the type of API token to retrieve. Valid values are 'LMv1', 'Bearer', or '*'. The default value is '*'.
Specifies the number of API tokens to retrieve per batch. The default value is 1000.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid LogicMonitor authentication session. Make sure to log in using the Connect-LMAccount function before running this command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAPIToken -AdminId 1234 Retrieves all API tokens associated with the admin ID 1234.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAPIToken -Id 5678 Retrieves the API token with the ID 5678.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAPIToken -AccessId "abc123" Retrieves the API token with the access ID "abc123".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAPIToken -Filter @{ Property1 = "Value1"; Property2 = "Value2" } Retrieves API tokens based on the specified custom filter object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAPIToken -Type "Bearer" -BatchSize 500 Retrieves API tokens of type 'Bearer' with a batch size of 500.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves LogicMonitor AppliesTo functions based on different parameters.

The Get-LMAppliesToFunction function retrieves LogicMonitor AppliesTo functions based on different parameters such as Id, Name, or Filter. It uses the LogicMonitor API to make the requests and returns the results.
Specifies the Id of the AppliesTo function to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name and Filter parameters.
Specifies the number of results to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the Name of the AppliesTo function to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Filter parameters.
Specifies the number of results to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.

Specifies a custom filter to apply when retrieving AppliesTo functions. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Name parameters. The filter should be an object that matches the filter structure expected by the LogicMonitor API.
Specifies the number of results to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the Id of the AppliesTo function to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name and Filter parameters.
Specifies the Name of the AppliesTo function to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Filter parameters.

Specifies a custom filter to apply when retrieving AppliesTo functions. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Name parameters. The filter should be an object that matches the filter structure expected by the LogicMonitor API.
Specifies the number of results to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid LogicMonitor API authentication. Make sure to log in using the Connect-LMAccount function before running any commands.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAppliesToFunction -Id 123 Retrieves the AppliesTo function with the specified Id.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAppliesToFunction -Name "MyFunction" Retrieves the AppliesTo function with the specified Name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAppliesToFunction -Filter @{ Property = "Value" } Retrieves the AppliesTo functions that match the specified custom filter.

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-LMAuditLogs function retrieves audit logs from LogicMonitor based on the specified parameters. It supports retrieving logs by ID, by date range, or by applying filters.
Specifies the ID of the audit log to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the SearchString, StartDate, EndDate, and Filter parameters.
Specifies the number of audit logs to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.

Specifies a search string to filter the audit logs. Only logs that contain the specified search string will be returned. This parameter is used in conjunction with the StartDate and EndDate parameters.

Specifies the start date of the audit logs to retrieve. Only logs that occurred on or after the specified start date will be returned. This parameter is used in conjunction with the SearchString and EndDate parameters.

Specifies the end date of the audit logs to retrieve. Only logs that occurred on or before the specified end date will be returned. This parameter is used in conjunction with the SearchString and StartDate parameters.
Specifies the number of audit logs to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies a filter object to further refine the audit logs to retrieve. This parameter is used in conjunction with the StartDate and EndDate parameters.
Specifies the number of audit logs to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the ID of the audit log to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the SearchString, StartDate, EndDate, and Filter parameters.

Specifies a search string to filter the audit logs. Only logs that contain the specified search string will be returned. This parameter is used in conjunction with the StartDate and EndDate parameters.

Specifies the start date of the audit logs to retrieve. Only logs that occurred on or after the specified start date will be returned. This parameter is used in conjunction with the SearchString and EndDate parameters.

Specifies the end date of the audit logs to retrieve. Only logs that occurred on or before the specified end date will be returned. This parameter is used in conjunction with the SearchString and StartDate parameters.
Specifies a filter object to further refine the audit logs to retrieve. This parameter is used in conjunction with the StartDate and EndDate parameters.
Specifies the number of audit logs to retrieve per request. The default value is 1000.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid connection to LogicMonitor. Use Connect-LMAccount to establish a connection before running this command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAuditLogs -Id "12345" Retrieves the audit log with the specified ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMAuditLogs -SearchString "login" -StartDate (Get-Date).AddDays(-7) -EndDate (Get-Date) Retrieves audit logs that contain the search string "login" and occurred within the last 7 days.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves information about cached accounts from the Logic.Monitor vault.

The Get-LMCachedAccount function retrieves information about cached accounts from the Logic.Monitor vault. It returns an array of custom objects containing details such as the cached account name, portal, ID, modified date, and type.
Specifies the name of a specific cached account to retrieve information for. If not provided, information for all cached accounts will be returned.
Specifies the name of a specific cached account to retrieve information for. If not provided, information for all cached accounts will be returned.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this function.
An array of custom objects representing the cached accounts. Each object contains the following properties:
- CachedAccountName: The name of the cached account.
- Portal: The portal associated with the cached account.
- Id: The ID of the cached account. If not available, "N/A" is displayed.
- Modified: The modified date of the cached account.
- Type: The type of the cached account. If not available, "LMv1" is displayed.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires the Get-SecretInfo function from the Logic.Monitor vault.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCachedAccount -CachedAccountName "Account1" Retrieves information for the cached account named "Account1" from the Logic.Monitor vault.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCachedAccount Retrieves information for all cached accounts from the Logic.Monitor vault.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves LogicMonitor collectors based on various parameters.

The Get-LMCollector function retrieves LogicMonitor collectors based on the specified parameters. It supports filtering by collector ID, collector name, or custom filter. The function uses the LogicMonitor REST API to make the requests.
Specifies the ID of the collector to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name and Filter parameters.
Specifies the number of collectors to retrieve in each batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the name of the collector to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Filter parameters.
Specifies the number of collectors to retrieve in each batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies a custom filter to retrieve collectors based on specific criteria. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Name parameters.
Specifies the number of collectors to retrieve in each batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the ID of the collector to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name and Filter parameters.
Specifies the name of the collector to retrieve. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Filter parameters.
Specifies a custom filter to retrieve collectors based on specific criteria. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id and Name parameters.
Specifies the number of collectors to retrieve in each batch. The default value is 1000.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid LogicMonitor API authentication. Use Connect-LMAccount to authenticate before running this command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollector -Id 123 Retrieves the collector with the specified ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollector -Name "Collector1" Retrieves the collector with the specified name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollector -Filter @{Property = "Value"} Retrieves collectors based on the specified custom filter.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the debug result for a LogicMonitor collector.
The Get-LMCollectorDebugResult function retrieves the debug result for a LogicMonitor collector based on the specified session ID, collector ID, or collector name.
The session ID of the debug session.

The session ID of the debug session.
The name of the collector. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'Name' parameter set.

command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollectorDebugResult -SessionId 12345 -Id 67890 Retrieves the debug result for the collector with ID 67890 in the debug session with ID 12345.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollectorDebugResult -SessionId 12345 -Name "Collector1" Retrieves the debug result for the collector with name "Collector1" in the debug session with ID 12345.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads the LogicMonitor Collector installer based on the specified parameters.

The Get-LMCollectorInstaller function downloads the LogicMonitor Collector installer based on the specified parameters. It requires a valid API authentication and can be used to download the installer for a specific collector by its ID or name. The function supports different operating systems and architectures, as well as collector sizes.
The ID of the collector for which to download the installer. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'Id' parameter set.
The size of the collector. Valid values are 'nano', 'small', 'medium', 'large', 'extra_large', and 'double_extra_large'. The default value is 'medium'.
The operating system and architecture of the collector. Valid values are 'Win64' and 'Linux64'. The default value is 'Win64'.
Specifies whether to use the Early Access (EA) version of the collector. By default, this parameter is set to $false.
The path where the downloaded installer file will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.
The name of the collector for which to download the installer. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'Name' parameter set.
The size of the collector. Valid values are 'nano', 'small', 'medium', 'large', 'extra_large', and 'double_extra_large'. The default value is 'medium'.
The operating system and architecture of the collector. Valid values are 'Win64' and 'Linux64'. The default value is 'Win64'.
Specifies whether to use the Early Access (EA) version of the collector. By default, this parameter is set to $false.
The path where the downloaded installer file will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.
The ID of the collector for which to download the installer. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'Id' parameter set.
The name of the collector for which to download the installer. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'Name' parameter set.
The size of the collector. Valid values are 'nano', 'small', 'medium', 'large', 'extra_large', and 'double_extra_large'. The default value is 'medium'.
The operating system and architecture of the collector. Valid values are 'Win64' and 'Linux64'. The default value is 'Win64'.
Specifies whether to use the Early Access (EA) version of the collector. By default, this parameter is set to $false.
The path where the downloaded installer file will be saved. By default, it is set to the current location.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollectorInstaller -Id 1234 -Size medium -OSandArch Win64 -DownloadPath "C:\Downloads"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Downloads the LogicMonitor Collector installer for the collector with ID 1234, using the 'medium' size and 'Win64' operating system and architecture. The installer file will be saved in the "C:\Downloads" directory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollectorInstaller -Name "MyCollector" -Size large -OSandArch Linux64

dev:remarks.maml:para: Downloads the LogicMonitor Collector installer for the collector with the name "MyCollector", using the 'large' size and 'Linux64' operating system and architecture. The installer file will be saved in the current location.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the versions of LogicMonitor collectors available for download.
The Get-LMCollectorVersions function retrieves the versions of LogicMonitor collectors based on the specified parameters. It requires a valid API authentication and authorization.
Specifies the filter to apply when retrieving collector versions. Only collector versions that match the specified filter will be returned.
Specifies the number of collector versions to retrieve in each batch. The default value is 1000.
Indicates whether to retrieve only the top versions of collector versions.
Specifies the number of collector versions to retrieve in each batch. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the filter to apply when retrieving collector versions. Only collector versions that match the specified filter will be returned.
Indicates whether to retrieve only the top versions of collector versions.
Specifies the number of collector versions to retrieve in each batch. The default value is 1000.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-LMCollectorVersions.
Returns an object that contains the retrieved collector versions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollectorVersions -Filter "name=Collector1"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the collector versions that have the name "Collector1".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollectorVersions -TopVersions

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves only the top versions of collector versions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMCollectorVersions -BatchSize 500

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the collector versions in batches of 500.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves LogicMonitor dashboards based on specified parameters.

Specifies the ID of the dashboard to retrieve.
Specifies the number of dashboards to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the name of the dashboard to retrieve.
Specifies the number of dashboards to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the ID of the group to filter the dashboards by.

Specifies the number of dashboards to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies a search string to filter the dashboards by group path.
Specifies the number of dashboards to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies a custom filter to apply to the dashboards. The filter should be an object that contains the filter properties.
Specifies the number of dashboards to retrieve in each request. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the ID of the dashboard to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the dashboard to retrieve.
Specifies the ID of the group to filter the dashboards by.
Specifies the name of the group to filter the dashboards by.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMDashboard -Id 123 Retrieves the dashboard with the specified ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMDashboard -Name "My Dashboard" Retrieves the dashboard with the specified name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMDashboard -GroupId 456 Retrieves the dashboards that belong to the group with the specified ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMDashboard -GroupPathSearchString "Subgroup" Retrieves the dashboards that belong to subgroups matching the specified search string.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LMDashboard -Filter @{Property1 = "Value1"; Property2 = "Value2"} Retrieves the dashboards that match the specified custom filter.

maml:description.maml:para: Get device info from a connected LM portal
Get device info from a connected LM portal
The device id for a device in LM.
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.
The display name value for a device in LM. This value can include wildcard input such as "*.example.com"
Switch used to return a deltaId along with the requested data to use for delta change tracking.
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.
The name value for a device in LM. This is the fqdn/ip used when adding a device into LM. This value accepts wildcard input such as "10.10.*"
Switch used to return a deltaId along with the requested data to use for delta change tracking.
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.
A hashtable of additional filter properties to include with request. All properties are treated as if using the equals ":" operator. When using multiple filters they are combined as AND conditions.
An example Filter to get devices with alerting enabled and where the display name contains equal.com: @{displayName="*.example.com";disableAlerting=$false}
Switch used to return a deltaId along with the requested data to use for delta change tracking.
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.
Switch used to return a deltaId along with the requested data to use for delta change tracking.
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.
The deltaId string for a delta query you want to see changes for.
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.
The device id for a device in LM.
The display name value for a device in LM. This value can include wildcard input such as "*.example.com"
The name value for a device in LM. This is the fqdn/ip used when adding a device into LM. This value accepts wildcard input such as "10.10.*"
A hashtable of additional filter properties to include with request. All properties are treated as if using the equals ":" operator. When using multiple filters they are combined as AND conditions.
An example Filter to get devices with alerting enabled and where the display name contains equal.com: @{displayName="*.example.com";disableAlerting=$false}
Switch used to return a deltaId along with the requested data to use for delta change tracking.
The deltaId string for a delta query you want to see changes for.
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.

maml:alert.maml:para: Consult the LM API docs for a list of allowed fields when using filter parameter as all fields are not available for use with filtering.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get all devices: Get-LMDevice

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get specific device: Get-LMDevice -Id 1 Get-LMDevice -DisplayName "device.example.com" Get-LMDevice -Name "10.10.10.10"
Get multiple devices using wildcards: Get-LMDevice -DisplayName "*.example.com" Get-LMDevice -Name "10.10.*"
Get device/s using a custom filter: Get-LMDevice -Filter "displayName -eq 'corp-*' -and preferredCollectorId -eq '1'"

An example Filter to get websites with type Webcheck that are internal: @{type="webcheck";isInternal=$true}
The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.

The return size for each request, this value if not specified defaults to 1000. If a result would return 1001 and items, two requests would be made to return the full set.

maml:alert.maml:para: Consult the LM API docs for a list of allowed fields when using filter parameter as all fields are not available for use with filtering.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get multiple websites using wildcards: Get-LMWebsite -Name "ServiceNow - *"

maml:description.maml:para: Imports LogicMonitor dashboards from various sources.

The `Import-LMDashboard` function allows you to import LogicMonitor dashboards from different sources, such as local files, GitHub repositories, or LogicMonitor dashboard groups. It supports importing dashboards in JSON format.

Specifies the path to a local file or directory containing the JSON dashboard files to import. If a directory is specified, all JSON files within the directory (and its subdirectories) will be imported.
Specifies the name of the parent dashboard group under which the imported dashboards will be placed. This parameter is mandatory when importing from a file or GitHub repository.
Indicates whether to replace API tokens in the imported dashboards with a dynamically generated API token. This is useful for managing API access to the dashboards.
Specifies the API token to use for replacing API tokens in the imported dashboards. This parameter is required when `ReplaceAPITokensOnImport` is set to `$true`.
Specifies the username of dashboard owner when creating dashboard as private.

Specifies the API token to use for replacing API tokens in the imported dashboards. This parameter is required when `ReplaceAPITokensOnImport` is set to `$true`.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-LMDashboard -FilePath "C:\Dashboards" -ParentGroupId 12345 -ReplaceAPITokensOnImport -APIToken $apiToken Imports all JSON dashboard files from the "C:\Dashboards" directory and its subdirectories. The imported dashboards will be placed under the dashboard group with ID 12345. API tokens in the imported dashboards will be replaced with the specified API token.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-LMDashboard -GithubUserRepo "username/repo" -ParentGroupName "MyDashboards" -ReplaceAPITokensOnImport -APIToken $apiToken Imports JSON dashboard files from the specified GitHub repository. The imported dashboards will be placed under the dashboard group with the name "MyDashboards". API tokens in the imported dashboards will be replaced with the specified API token.

maml:description.maml:para: The Import-LMExchangeModule function is used to import an LM Exchange module into LogicMonitor.
The LM Exchange module ID to import. This parameter is mandatory.
The LM Exchange module ID to import. This parameter is mandatory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-LMExchangeModule -LMExchangeId "LM12345" Imports the LM Exchange module with the ID "LM12345" into LogicMonitor.

maml:description.maml:para: The Import-LMLogicModule function imports a LogicModule into LogicMonitor. It can import the LogicModule from a file path or directly from file data. The LogicModule can be of different types such as datasource, propertyrules, eventsource, topologysource, or configsource.
Specifies the path of the file containing the LogicModule to import. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'FilePath' parameter set.
Specifies the type of the LogicModule to import. The valid values are 'datasource', 'propertyrules', 'eventsource', 'topologysource', or 'configsource'. The default value is 'datasource'.

Indicates whether to overwrite an existing LogicModule with the same name. If set to $true, the existing LogicModule will be overwritten. If set to $false, an error will be thrown if a LogicModule with the same name already exists. The default value is $false.
Specifies the file data of the LogicModule to import. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'File' parameter set.
Specifies the type of the LogicModule to import. The valid values are 'datasource', 'propertyrules', 'eventsource', 'topologysource', or 'configsource'. The default value is 'datasource'.

Indicates whether to overwrite an existing LogicModule with the same name. If set to $true, the existing LogicModule will be overwritten. If set to $false, an error will be thrown if a LogicModule with the same name already exists. The default value is $false.
Specifies the path of the file containing the LogicModule to import. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'FilePath' parameter set.
Specifies the file data of the LogicModule to import. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'File' parameter set.
Specifies the type of the LogicModule to import. The valid values are 'datasource', 'propertyrules', 'eventsource', 'topologysource', or 'configsource'. The default value is 'datasource'.

Indicates whether to overwrite an existing LogicModule with the same name. If set to $true, the existing LogicModule will be overwritten. If set to $false, an error will be thrown if a LogicModule with the same name already exists. The default value is $false.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires PowerShell version 6.1 or higher to run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-LMLogicModule -FilePath "C:\LogicModules\datasource.xml" -Type "datasource" -ForceOverwrite $true Imports a datasource LogicModule from the file 'datasource.xml' located in the 'C:\LogicModules' directory. If a LogicModule with the same name already exists, it will be overwritten.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-LMLogicModule -File $fileData -Type "propertyrules" Imports a propertyrules LogicModule using the file data provided in the $fileData variable. If a LogicModule with the same name already exists, an error will be thrown.

maml:description.maml:para: The Import-LMRepositoryLogicModules function imports logic modules from the LogicMonitor repository. It requires the user to be logged in and have valid API credentials.
Specifies the type of logic modules to import. Valid values are "datasources", "propertyrules", "eventsources", "topologysources", and "configsources".
Specifies the names of the logic modules to import. This parameter accepts an array of strings.
Specifies the type of logic modules to import. Valid values are "datasources", "propertyrules", "eventsources", "topologysources", and "configsources".
Specifies the names of the logic modules to import. This parameter accepts an array of strings.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-LMRepositoryLogicModules -Type "datasources" -LogicModuleNames "DataSource1", "DataSource2" Imports the logic modules with the names "DataSource1" and "DataSource2" from the LogicMonitor repository.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes an active discovery task for LogicMonitor devices.

The Invoke-LMActiveDiscovery function is used to schedule an active discovery task for LogicMonitor devices. It accepts parameters to specify the devices for which the active discovery task should be scheduled.
Specifies the ID of the device for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name parameter.
Specifies the name of the device for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id parameter.
Specifies the ID of the device group for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the GroupName parameter.
Specifies the name of the device group for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the GroupId parameter.
Specifies the ID of the device for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Name parameter.
Specifies the name of the device for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the Id parameter.
Specifies the ID of the device group for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the GroupName parameter.
Specifies the name of the device group for which the active discovery task should be scheduled. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the GroupId parameter.

maml:alert.maml:para: - This function requires a valid API authentication. Make sure you are logged in before running any commands.
- Use the Connect-LMAccount function to log in and obtain valid API credentials.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMActiveDiscovery -Id 12345 Invokes an active discovery task for the device with ID 12345.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMActiveDiscovery -Name "MyDevice" Invokes an active discovery task for the device with the name "MyDevice".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMActiveDiscovery -GroupId "123" Invokes an active discovery task for all devices in the device group with ID "123".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMActiveDiscovery -GroupName "Group2" Invokes an active discovery task for all devices in the device group with the name "Group2".

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a LogicMonitor Cloud Group NetScan task.
The Invoke-LMCloudGroupNetScan function is used to schedule a LogicMonitor Cloud Group NetScan task. It requires either the GroupId or GroupName parameter to identify the target device group.
Specifies the ID of the target device group. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId' parameter set.
Specifies the name of the target device group. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupName' parameter set.
Specifies the ID of the target device group. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupId' parameter set.
Specifies the name of the target device group. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'GroupName' parameter set.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid LogicMonitor API authentication. Make sure you are logged in before running any commands using the Connect-LMAccount cmdlet. You must target a device gropup that belongs to a cloud account (EC2, etc)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMCloudGroupNetScan -Id "12345" Schedules a LogicMonitor Cloud Group NetScan task for the device group with the ID "12345".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMCloudGroupNetScan -Name "MyGroup" Schedules a LogicMonitor Cloud Group NetScan task for the device group with the name "MyGroup".

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a NetScan task in LogicMonitor.

The Invoke-LMNetScan function is used to execute a NetScan task in LogicMonitor. It checks if the user is logged in and has valid API credentials before making the API call. If the user is logged in, it builds the necessary headers and URI, and then issues a GET request to execute the NetScan task. If the request is successful, it returns a message indicating that the NetScan task has been scheduled.
The ID of the NetScan task to be executed. This parameter is mandatory.
The ID of the NetScan task to be executed. This parameter is mandatory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMNetScan -Id "12345" Schedules the NetScan task with ID "12345" in LogicMonitor.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a session logoff for one or more users in Logic Monitor.

The Invoke-LMUserLogoff function is used to log off one or more users from a Logic Monitor session. It checks if the user is logged in and has valid API credentials before making the logoff request. If the user is not logged in, an error message is displayed.
Specifies an array of usernames for which the session logoff needs to be invoked.
Specifies an array of usernames for which the session logoff needs to be invoked.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-LMUserLogoff -Usernames "user1", "user2" Invokes a session logoff for the users "user1" and "user2" in Logic Monitor.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new alert acknowledgment in LogicMonitor.
The New-LMAlertAck function is used to create a new alert acknowledgment in LogicMonitor. It sends a POST request to the LogicMonitor API to acknowledge one or more alerts.
Specifies the alert IDs to be acknowledged. This parameter is mandatory and accepts an array of strings.
Specifies the note to be added to the acknowledgment. This parameter is mandatory and accepts a string.
Specifies the alert IDs to be acknowledged. This parameter is mandatory and accepts an array of strings.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid API authentication. Make sure you are logged in before running any commands by using the Connect-LMAccount function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMAlertAck -Ids @("12345","67890") -Note "Acknowledging alerts"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example acknowledges the alerts with the IDs "12345" and "67890" and adds the note "Acknowledging alerts" to the acknowledgment.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new note for one or more LogicMonitor alerts.
The New-LMAlertNote function creates a new note for one or more LogicMonitor alerts. It requires the alert IDs and the note content as mandatory parameters.
Specifies the alert IDs for which the note needs to be created. This parameter accepts an array of strings.
Specifies the content of the note to be created. This parameter accepts a string.

System.String. Returns a success message if the note is created successfully.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMAlertNote -Ids @("12345","67890") -Note "This is a sample note."

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new note with the content "This is a sample note" for the alerts with IDs "12345" and "67890".

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new LogicMonitor API token.

The 'Username' parameter set is used to specify the username for which the API token will be created. The function also supports additional parameters such as 'Note', 'CreateDisabled', and 'Type'.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new LogicMonitor API user.
The New-LMAPIUser function is used to create a new LogicMonitor API user. It requires a username and supports optional parameters such as user groups, a note, role names, and status.
Specifies the username for the new API user. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies an array of user groups to which the new API user should be added. This parameter is optional.
Specifies a note for the new API user. This parameter is optional.
Specifies an array of role names for the new API user. The default value is "readonly". This parameter is optional.
Specifies the status of the new API user. Valid values are "active" and "suspended". The default value is "active". This parameter is optional.
Specifies the username for the new API user. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies an array of user groups to which the new API user should be added. This parameter is optional.
Specifies a note for the new API user. This parameter is optional.
Specifies an array of role names for the new API user. The default value is "readonly". This parameter is optional.
Specifies the status of the new API user. Valid values are "active" and "suspended". The default value is "active". This parameter is optional.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires a valid API session. Make sure to log in using the Connect-LMAccount function before running this command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMAPIUser -Username "john.doe" -UserGroups @("Group1","Group2") -Note "Test user" -RoleNames "admin" -Status "active"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new API user with the username "john.doe", adds the user to "Group1" and "Group2" user groups, adds a note "Test user", assigns the "admin" role, and sets the status to "active".

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new LogicMonitor Applies To function.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new LogicMonitor dashboard group.

command:example.dev:code: New-LMDeviceDatasourceSDT -Comment "Daily maintenance" -StartHour 3 -StartMinute 0 -ParameterSet Daily -DeviceDataSourceId 123 Creates a new daily device datasource SDT with a comment "Daily maintenance" starting at 03:00.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMDeviceDatasourceSDT -Comment "Monthly maintenance" -StartHour 8 -StartMinute 30 -ParameterSet Monthly -DeviceDataSourceId 123 Creates a new monthly device datasource SDT with a comment "Monthly maintenance" starting on the 1st day of each month at 08:30.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMDeviceDatasourceSDT -Comment "Weekly maintenance" -StartHour 10 -StartMinute 0 -ParameterSet Weekly -DeviceDataSourceId 123 Creates a new weekly device datasource SDT with a comment "Weekly maintenance" starting every Monday at 10:00.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMDeviceGroupSDT -Comment "Maintenance window" -StartDate "2022-01-01 00:00:00" -EndDate "2022-01-01 06:00:00" -StartHour 2 -DeviceGroupName "Production Servers" Creates a new scheduled downtime for the "Production Servers" device group, starting from January 1, 2022, 00:00:00 and ending on January 1, 2022, 06:00:00. The scheduled downtime will occur every day at 2 AM.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new enhanced network scan in LogicMonitor.

The New-LMEnhancedNetScan function creates a new enhanced network scan in LogicMonitor. It allows you to specify various parameters such as the collector ID, name, net scan group name, custom credentials, filters, description, exclude duplicate type, method, next start, next start epoch, Groovy script, credential group ID, and credential group name.
The ID of the collector where the network scan will be executed.
The next start epoch for the network scan. Default value is "0".
The Groovy script to be executed during the network scan.
The ID of the credential group to be used for the network scan.
The name of the credential group to be used for the network scan.
The name of the network scan.
The name of the net scan group.
A list of custom credentials to be used for the network scan.
A list of filters to be applied to the network scan.
A description of the network scan.
The type of duplicates to be excluded. Default value is "1".
The method to be used for the network scan. Default value is "enhancedScript".
The next start time for the network scan. Default value is "manual".
The ID of the collector where the network scan will be executed.
The name of the network scan.
The name of the net scan group.
A list of custom credentials to be used for the network scan.
A list of filters to be applied to the network scan.

The type of duplicates to be excluded. Default value is "1".
The method to be used for the network scan. Default value is "enhancedScript".
The next start time for the network scan. Default value is "manual".
The next start epoch for the network scan. Default value is "0".
The Groovy script to be executed during the network scan.
The ID of the credential group to be used for the network scan.
The name of the credential group to be used for the network scan.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information about LogicMonitor network scans, refer to the LogicMonitor documentation.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMEnhancedNetScan -CollectorId "12345" -Name "MyNetScan" -NetScanGroupName "Group1" -CustomCredentials $customCreds -Filters $filters -Description "This is a network scan" -ExcludeDuplicateType "1" -Method "enhancedScript" -NextStart "manual" -NextStartEpoch "0" -GroovyScript "script" -CredentialGroupId "67890" -CredentialGroupName "Group2"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new enhanced network scan with the specified parameters.

The next start time epoch for the network scan. The default value is "0".

The ID of the network scan group to assign the network scan to. The default value is "1".
The subnet range to scan. This parameter is mandatory.
The ID of the credential group to use for the network scan.
The name of the credential group to use for the network scan.
The token to use for changing the name of discovered devices. The default value is "##REVERSEDNS##".

maml:description.maml:para: The New-LMOpsNote function is used to create a new OpsNote in LogicMonitor. OpsNotes are used to document important information or events related to monitoring.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LMOpsNote -Note "Server maintenance scheduled for tomorrow" -NoteDate (Get-Date).AddDays(1) -Tags "maintenance", "server"

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new data point object for pushing metric data to LogicMonitor.

The New-LMPushMetricDataPoint function creates a new data point object that can be used to push metric data to LogicMonitor. The function accepts an array of data points, where each data point consists of a name and a value. The function also allows you to specify the data point type, aggregation type, and percentile value.
An optional parameter that allows you to pass an existing array of data points. If not provided, a new array will be created.
A mandatory parameter that accepts an array of data points. Each data point should be an object with a Name and a Value property.
Specifies the type of the data point. Valid values are "counter", "derive", and "gauge". The default value is "gauge".
Specifies the aggregation type of the data point. Valid values are "min", "max", "avg", "sum", "none", and "percentile". The default value is "none".
Specifies the percentile value for the data point. This parameter is only applicable when the DataPointAggregationType is set to "percentile". The value should be between 0 and 100.
An optional parameter that allows you to pass an existing array of data points. If not provided, a new array will be created.
A mandatory parameter that accepts an array of data points. Each data point should be an object with a Name and a Value property.
Specifies the type of the data point. Valid values are "counter", "derive", and "gauge". The default value is "gauge".
Specifies the aggregation type of the data point. Valid values are "min", "max", "avg", "sum", "none", and "percentile". The default value is "none".
Specifies the percentile value for the data point. This parameter is only applicable when the DataPointAggregationType is set to "percentile". The value should be between 0 and 100.

maml:alert.maml:para: LogicMonitor API credentials must be set before using this function. Use the Connect-LMAccount function to log in and set the credentials.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates two data points for CPU usage and memory usage, and sets the data point type to "gauge" and the aggregation type to "avg".
